title: Fix #2646 tree root handle one child
body:
Hey Mike! I added  fix for #2646. 
The issue was the tree.separation method was using the depth of the left and right nodes. In the case in which the root had only one child, both nodes were equal to root (left and right = root) which has a depth of 0 causing it to fail. So, on line 7053 of d3.js I made if (node.x < left.x) left = node; to if (node.x <= left.x) left = node;
I hope that is an appropriate fix. It passed all the tests.
Also, thank you for making d3. It is awesome!

title: Merge pull request #1 from mbostock/master
body: Update My Repo

title: Adds support for domainSegmented() on quantitative scales.
body:
`domainSegmented()` splits the domain in segments which "walk the range at uniform speed". This means that if one replaces a 2-segment range [mn, mx] with a uniformly-split range [mn, ..., mx] of length l, then replacing the domain [mnD, mxD] with domainSegmented([mnD, mxD], l) will have no effect.

This transformation is useful when the range of a scale is (say) a highly-segmented colorbrewer scale, and one wishes to interpolate between the endpoints at the appropriate speed. More concretely, it allows one to easily change a colormap from:

`d3.scale.linear().domainSegmented([mnD, mxD], 6).range(colorbrewer.Blues[6])`

to

`d3.scale.log().domainSegmented([mnD, mxD], 6).range(colorbrewer.Blues[6])`

or

`d3.scale.pow().exponent(.5).domainSegmented([mnD, mxD], 6).range(colorbrewer.Blues[6])`

and the domain segments are split correctly.

title: Suitably zealous click canceling.
body: This reverts #312, since we later implemented a more robust check in #1005 using a zero-delay timeout to expire click suppression.

title: Fix #2613 - avoid Firefox hoisting bug.
body: Firefox doesn’t correctly hoist functions defined inside if blocks, so move the functions out of the if block.

title: fix collections `forEach` method to follow JS spec
body:
In order to be consistent with the Map and Set spec, I have refactored
the forEach method on both collection primitives.

**THIS DOES INTRODUCE A BREAKING CHANGE**

title: Add a property for a custom zoom factor to the zoom behavior.
body: When using the zoom behavior at the moment zooming by mouse wheel or double click causes a zoom which is a multiple of 2. A custom zoom factor would allow more control over zooming speed, especially with mouse wheels.

title: Cancel pre-empted transitions synchronously.
body:
When a scheduled transition is pre-empted by a newer transition starting, we now cancel the old transition’s timers immediately, rather than waiting for the old transition to start.

TODO:
- [x] d3.timer should return void (at least until 3.6 or 4.0)
- [x] verify whether those errors can be thrown

title: Added Hungarian locale
body: Added Hungarian locale and a test for it

title: Fix for null node in selection.data.
body:
If a selection is missing elements, then selection.data would still attempt to evaluate the optional key function for the missing elements, resulting in an uncaught TypeError. For example:

``` js
d3.selectAll("p")
  .select(function(d, i) { return i & 1 ? this : null; })
    .data([1, 2, 3], Number);
```

Now, any missing elements are automatically assigned to the exit selection.

title: Flextree
body:
Fixes #1992.  See the [demo](http://klortho.github.io/d3-flextree/).

See [klortho/d3-flextree](https://github.com/klortho/d3-flextree) for more info.  This is a rewrite of layout/tree.js, based on [this code](https://github.com/cwi-swat/non-layered-tidy-trees) from a 2013 paper, [Drawing Non-layered Tidy Trees in Linear Time](http://oai.cwi.nl/oai/asset/21856/21856B.pdf). A.J. van der Ploeg, 2013.

I also wrote a script to turn it into a plugin, which I listed on your plugin wiki page.

I added a bunch of tests to test/layout/tree-test.js, and there are a lot more tests, include regression tests, [here](http://klortho.github.io/d3-flextree/test/).

title: make more like ES6 Set
body: Even though in a sense the ES6 spec isn't intuitive (.keys() / .entries()?)

title: make d3.map / d3.set more like ES6 Map / Set
body: Although .size is still a function and not a getter as in ES6

title: Uglify Preserve Comments
body:
Addresses suggestion: Preserve comments in d3.js (issue #2554)
https://github.com/mbostock/d3/issues/2554

title: Check if NaN
body: Check if resulting endAngle is NaN, if it is set it to 0. Fixes [Issue 2475](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/issues/2475)

title: Only prevent default on mousewheel event when trying to zoom within the scaleExtent
body: fixes https://github.com/mbostock/d3/issues/2549

title: Fix drag behavior on for <svg:use> elements
body:
Drag behavior is broken for svg:use elements on certain
browsers. This includes `d3.layout.force(...).drag()`

On browsers like Internet Explorer 11, the `<svg:use>`
EventTarget is represented by a SVGElementInstance that looks
like this:

```
    [object SVGElementInstance]
       {
          [functions]: ,
          __proto__: { },
          childNodes: { },
          constructor: { },
          correspondingElement: { },
          correspondingUseElement: { },
          firstChild: null,
          lastChild: null,
          nextSibling: null,
          parentNode: { },
          previousSibling: { }
       }
```

No other properties such as `event.target.style` are present. We must use the
`event.target.correspondingElement` property to access the actual SVG element
instantiated by the `<svg:use>` in order to have a successful drag.

title: Pointer (and MSPointer) events for the zoom behavior.
body: Added support of Pointer events in addition to Touch events

title: Add missing import
body:
Without this, custom builds that depend on behavior/zoom, yet don't
include transitions fail to include the needed d3_selection_interrupt.

title: Add margin parameter to pack layout
body:
This PR adds the `margin` parameter to the pack layout. It allows to specify the distance to the parent circle in the same way that the `padding` parameter allows to specify the distance to the sibling circles.

Demo [here](http://bl.ocks.org/larskotthoff/085bb57f710aa417af41). I implemented this in response to [a question on Stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32235067/padding-and-margin-on-pack-layout).

title: Create sv-SE.js - Swedish locale
body: Added support for Swedish locale

title: make fractional steps more predictable
body: An attempt to take into account limited floating point precision with the goal of making the number of returned array elements more predictable. See issue #2524.

title: fix bug of monotone curve in local extremum
body: I find that the curve generated by d3_svg_lineMonotone sometimes has a “bump”, so i try to read the understand the algorithm in  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monotone_cubic_interpolation 。

title: Setting attributes using a function.
body:
Heya,

A little contribution to enable to set multiple attributes at once. Like `x` and `y` for a `svg` element.

Use case, being able to set two arguments at once (code from http://bl.ocks.org/mbostock/4207744)

``` javascript
// Using translate
  svg.selectAll("text")
      .data(cantons.features)
    .enter().append("text")
      .attr("transform", function(d) { return "translate(" + path.centroid(d) + ")"; })
      .text(function(d) { return d.properties.name; });
// Using x/y
  svg.selectAll("text")
      .data(cantons.features)
    .enter().append("text")
      .attr(function(d) { var c = path.centroid(d); return {x: c[0], y: c[1]} })
      .text(function(d) { return d.properties.name; });
```

title: add d3.time.milliseconds to support millisecond resolution ticks
body:
This addition makes it very easy to have millisecond resolution ticks on the axis 

e.g.

```
maxBottomAxis.ticks(d3.time.milliseconds, 100).tickFormat(d3.time.format('%L'));
```

Issue #1529 does not provide quite the same functionality since it requires an explicit modification of the data.

```
d.time = new Date(+d.time * 1000);
```
